holidays.name: National Sangria Day
holidays.description: A delightful day dedicated to celebrating the vibrant and refreshing Spanish punch known as sangria, made from wine, fruit, and often a splash of brandy or soda.
holidays.origin: While the exact origin is unclear, National Sangria Day gained popularity in the U.S. as part of trends embracing international wines and cocktails.
holidays.funFact: Sangria gets its name from the Spanish word 'sangre' meaning blood, inspired by its deep red color.

holidays.name: International Human Solidarity Day
holidays.description: A day to recognize the importance of solidarity in addressing global challenges, promoting unity and cooperation among peoples and nations.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 2005 to encourage efforts towards global harmony and poverty eradication.
holidays.funFact: This day underscores the role of solidarity in achieving the UN's Sustainable Development Goals.

holidays.name: Look for an Evergreen Day
holidays.description: Encourages people to seek out evergreen trees ‚Äî symbols of life and endurance ‚Äî especially in the winter months, reminding us that life persists even in the coldest seasons.
holidays.origin: An unofficial day created to connect people with nature and the beauty of evergreens during winter.
holidays.funFact: Evergreens remain green all year round by retaining their needles rather than shedding leaves like deciduous trees.

holidays.name: Bazaar Day
holidays.description: A quirky day celebrating fun bazaars, marketplaces, and vibrant trading traditions that bring communities together in curious and joyful ways.
holidays.origin: Inspired by traditional markets that have been cultural hubs for centuries around the world.
holidays.funFact: In some cultures, bazaars serve not just as markets, but as social centers for music, storytelling, and festivities.
